title: Identify the Target Reaction
text: The target reaction is the combustion of propane: C₃H₈(g)+5O₂(g)→3CO₂(g)+4H₂O(l).

title: Use Hess's Law
text: Hess's Law states that the total enthalpy change for a reaction is the sum of the enthalpy changes for each step. Use the given reactions to construct the target reaction.

title: Reverse and Adjust Equations
text: Reverse the third equation to form propane from its elements, and adjust the coefficients to match the target reaction.

title: Calculate Enthalpy Changes
text: Calculate the enthalpy change for each step, considering the direction and coefficients of the reactions.

title: Sum the Enthalpy Changes
text: Add the enthalpy changes from each step to find the total enthalpy change for the combustion of propane.
